title: Gran claims she was covered in '70 bed bug bites' following a night in Premier Inn
text:

A furious gran says she was left riddled with weeping sores after finding herself covered in "70 bed bug bites" following a night in a Premier Inn hotel.

Lisa Adams, 43, stayed with husband Steven Adams, 50, at the hotel in Priory Marina, Bedford, during a trip to visit their grandchildren in September.

They paid £58 for their one-night stay but, in the morning, gran-of-three Lisa claims she found her legs and lower tummy riddled with itchy and inflamed red bites - a claim the hotel strongly denies.

The angry guest reported the problem but says a member of staff promised to investigate after admitting "we've not had any problems like this for a long time".

And six weeks on, Lisa says the bites have become infected and were leaking pus, leaving her feeling itchy all over and like her blood is 'boiling' inside her.

(Image: Kennedy News and Media)

The grandmother, who herself is a customer service manager, said: "I was gobsmacked when the pharmacist I visited said it looked like I had bed bug bites."

But Premier Inn said it investigated Lisa's complaint but external specialists found "no evidence of bed bugs in the room she was allocated".

Lisa, of St Austell, Cornwall, continued: "I felt a bit dirty with all these red blotches on me.

"I scrubbed in the shower in case anything was still on me, it didn't make me feel very nice at all.

"They were on the front and back of my legs from the ankle to the top of my leg and the bottom of my stomach.

(Image: Kennedy News and Media)

(Image: Kennedy News and Media)

"They were very itchy but I didn't want to scratch them because they already sore and I didn't want to make them more painful.

"We've been to Mexico and travelled to Australia, China and lots of different places and I've never been bitten by anything.

"Now I think I might have an infection because my body is itching all over and it feels like my blood is boiling inside me."

Lisa, wearing a long pyjama top, got under the duvet and fell asleep after enjoying a meal out with HGV driver Steven.

"The room looked clean to the naked eye, there were no obvious signs of anything dirty but I didn't pull back the sheets and check the mattress and the duvet," she said.

(Image: Kennedy News and Media)

"When you walk into a hotel you don't expect to have to check things like that.

"When we got up my husband said I'd been a bit restless in the night - [I'm not sure] whether I was conscious that something was happening or whether it was because I was in a strange place."

After noticing her wounds, Lisa binned their overnight suitcase and £150-worth of clothing in the fear she might take any creepy crawly stowaways with her.

Lisa added: "The way they've handled the complain is appalling.

"Given the severity of the bites it needed to be highlighted. If that had been an older person they may not be robust enough to fight the infection as I have, it could have been worse.

"To be fobbed off the way I was is just not right, I won't be staying with Premier Inn again after this."

(Image: Google Maps, copyright unknown)

A Premier Inn spokesman said: "To ensure that we are proactive in matters of this nature, our housekeeping and maintenance teams are fully trained to spot the signs of bed bugs.

"In this instance, upon receiving the complaint our specially-trained team members examined the room and their stringent checks revealed no evidence of bed bugs.

"Nonetheless, in the interests of caution, the team have since engaged with external specialists to launch their own inspection of the guest's room and they have independently confirmed that there is absolutely no evidence of bed bugs in the room Mrs Adams' was allocated."
description: Lisa Adams, who stayed at the Premier Inn in Priory Marina, Bedford, said she felt like her blood was "boiling" inside her after her stay
